result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lavelle Devon Slater

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lavelle Devon Slater in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Lavelle Devon Slater.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status conference. Attorney Jaspen has recently been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Completion of Representation.  Received and Filed.  nk
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

8:38 AM Defendant Lavelle Devon Slater in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Lavelle Devon Slater appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Margo Elise Clark appeared by video for Lavelle Devon Slater. Attorney Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lavelle Devon Slater not in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/28/22 @ 1p
